articles.title: Whether it’s a mini-sabbatical or an adult gap year, more people are taking extended work breaks
articles.description:
More companies are allowing weeks or months of paid or unpaid leave as a way to retain valued employees.

The post Whether it’s a mini-sabbatical or an adult gap year, more people are taking extended work breaks appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Companies in Boston are increasingly offering paid or unpaid leave to retain employees.
Extended work breaks are becoming popular among local professionals seeking better work-life balance.
This trend may lead to improved employee satisfaction and retention rates in Boston's workforce.

articles.title: Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme
articles.description:
The men worked with co-conspirators to steal mailed checks and redeposit them into bank accounts that they controlled.

The post Mass. men sentenced to prison for mail theft, check fraud scheme appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Two Massachusetts men were sentenced for a mail theft and check fraud scheme.
They stole checks and redeposited them into accounts they controlled, affecting local residents.
The scheme raises concerns about mail security and financial safety in Boston.

articles.title: Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address
articles.description:
Rep. Seth Moulton, who invited the teen to the Capitol, said his story “captures what’s broken in our immigration system.”

The post Milford teen detained by ICE last year invited to State of the Union address appeared first on Boston.com.
summary: Milford teen invited to State of the Union by Rep. Seth Moulton.
Teen's detention by ICE last year highlights immigration system issues.
Event raises awareness among Boston residents about local immigration challenges.
